Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: I identified the recurring patterns in the provided Windows system log, such as switching between applications, editing, and saving documents.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: I deduced that each document or task worked on by the user corresponds to a distinct case, based on the timestamps and transitions between applications.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: By analyzing the sequence of events, I generalized that 'FOCUS' events followed by 'TYPING' or 'SAVE' indicate document editing sessions.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: I hypothesized that revisiting a document after working on another application could represent either a continuation of the same case or a new instance. For clarity, I treated revisits as new cases.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: I cross-checked the inferred case structure against the sequence of actions to ensure coherence in the narrative of user activities.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: While grouping the events, I revisited earlier assumptions and adjusted cases where switching back to the same document was involved.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: I used heuristic rules to translate low-level actions (e.g., 'TYPING', 'SAVE') into standardized activity names, ensuring they are meaningful for process analysis.
